page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY, EGERTON
page.content: The village originally centred on the Dimple area to the north of the present village, with a church, chapel, and church school opened in 1790 through public subscription. The landlord resided at Dimple Hall, built in 1688 in course rubble masonry for a barrister Sergeant Welch.The old Turnpike Road connecting Bolton and Blackburn ran westerly at Dimple, and the Globe Cottages, dated 1423 mark its route. A new toll road was built in the 1830's, coinciding with the development of mills to the south, and workers residences. A dispute between the mill owners, residing at Egerton Hall, Dunscar House,Egerton House and the Holmses, the latter two of which remain, causedthe rebuilding of the Church and school in 1839 in the south of the village.Local inns served as coaching stations.
